data.title: Digital Stories & Presentations
data.meta_description: Transform your GIS-based data into digital stories and slide-based presentations that resonate with the meaningful context of your dynamic ArcGIS maps, 3D scenes, and embedded content.
data.text:
Use ArcGIS StoryMaps to combine maps, 3D scenes, embedded content, multimedia, and more into an interactive narrative that can create awareness, influence opinion, and affect change. The easy-to-use builder helps you create digital stories and presentations called briefings that incorporate your dynamic geographic information system (GIS) work and external content. Stories and briefings can be organized into collections and customized with themes.

Express maps, unique to ArcGIS StoryMaps, enable you to create custom maps that are artful and informative. Design your own interactive express map in minutes and add points, pop-ups, and arrows to enhance your stories and briefings. Your readers can interact with an express map without leaving your story or presentation.

You can also use your existing ArcGIS web maps and web scenes, create a new map using Esri demographic and lifestyle data, or choose from a curated collection of ready-to-use maps from the ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World.

Use a flexible, easy-to-use builder to weave together maps, 3D scenes, embedded content, video, photos, text, audio, and more into a digital story or presentation. With advanced image editing, you can crop, resize, and adjust your images right from the builder. Tell your story and make an impact on your audience, wherever they are.

The art of storytelling is at your fingertips. Transform the look and feel of your stories, briefings, and collections with the click of a button. Choose from a selection of beautiful, pre-designed themes, or create your own to capture your brand.

Select a theme that fits your narrative or presentation bestâ€”there is no need to style each element individually. Impress your audience with polished, professional-looking content that demonstrates your storytelling skills.

Increase your visibility and influence in your organization. Publish stories and briefings as a standalone narrative or in a collection. Share ArcGIS StoryMaps content with stakeholders via a link, embed it within your website, and circulate it across social platforms using built-in tools. Understand the impact of your digital storytelling with analytics that give you clear insights into your audience and how they are engaging with your content.
